Legal_Issue: Whether defendants can amend their defense to challenge the validity of the plaintiff's trademarks based on misstated first use dates
Procedural_Stage: Amendment of defense and counterclaim after limitation period
Evidence_Assessment: Misstated first use dates in trademark registration
Decision_Outcome: Defendants permitted to amend defenses and file counterclaim
Burden_of_Proof: On defendants to prove material false statements in trademark registration
Legal_Rule: Amendments allowed under Rule 201 if arising from same facts or no limitation period applies; false statements under Section 18 can invalidate trademarks
Standard_of_Review: Appellate review of discretion to allow amendments
Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and procedural fairness of allowing amendment post-limitation period
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged misrepresentation of first use dates in trademark application
Decision_Maker: Prothonotary Lafreni√®re; Federal Court on appeal
Key_Evidence_Considered: Dates of first use claimed in trademark registration
Applicant_Challenge: Seanix challenged the procedural correctness of allowing amendments
Legal_Rule_Source: Rule 201, Federal Courts Rules; Section 18, Trade-marks Act
Defendant_Response: Sought to amend defense and file counterclaim challenging trademark validity
Remedy_Sought: Dismissal of infringement claim based on invalidity of trademarks
Legal_Provision: Section 18 of the Trade-marks Act, Rule 201 of the Federal Courts Rules
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 18, Trade-marks Act; Rule 201, Federal Courts Rules
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Misstated first use dates constituting material falsehood
Applicable_Process: Amendment of pleadings, counterclaim, appellate review
